H0.text: From the Greek words for dry and plant what word is given to a plant that has adapted to survive in an environment with little available water. Xeron

H1.text: From the Greek words for dry and plant what word is given to a plant that has adapted to survive in an environment with little available water. Phytosic

H2.text: From the Greek words for dry and plant what word is given to a plant that has adapted to survive in an environment with little available water. Xylophyte

H3.text: From the Greek words for dry and plant what word is given to a plant that has adapted to survive in an environment with little available water. Xerad

A4.text: A xerophyte (from Ancient Greek ξηρός (xērós) 'dry' and φυτόν (phutón) 'plant') is a species of plant that has adaptations to survive in an environment with little liquid water.

A5.text: Xerophytes such as cacti are capable of withstanding extended periods of dry conditions as they have deep-spreading roots and capacity to store water.
